newsitem.title: USA: BGE restores 646 MW Md. coal power plant.
newsitem.headline: BGE restores 646 MW Md. coal power plant.

text.p: Baltimore Gas & Electric Co (BGE) said Tuesday its 646 megawatt (MW) coal-fired Brandon Shores unit 2 resumed full output after being shut on Sept 13 for seasonal maintenance.
"It came back on line over the weekend, and it's at 100 percent power," a BGE spokeswoman said.
The Brandon Shores unit is in metropolitan Baltimore in Anne Arundale County, Md., and accounts for about 10 percent of BGE's installed generating capacity.
Baltimore Gas & Electric is the operator and sole owner of Brandon Shores.
